instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight
threads.message: good, this macbook was changed 2 times backlight chip <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> and after a week it comes back and fails with the same original failure, this is the original video failure. macbook works well and the light goes out, it was already tried with another screen and the problem persists.   [URL]https://www.youtube.com/shorts/20yXILa1XbI[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight
threads.message:
Did you check XW7720 bridge?
Be sure <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM signals are stable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight
threads.message: XW7720 there is continuity, <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM are stable 3.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight
threads.message:
Possibly bad solders.
Heat the chip and gently tap it on top.
Put some good flux...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight
threads.message: change backlight driver <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>, and backlight is not working. <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>=0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight
threads.message:
Check the resistors which generates <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> signal.
Do you still have image?
